pullRequest.body:
Deletes `Commutative` and `Associative` in favour of `Std.Commutative` and `Std.Associative`.

Further, deletes all declarations in that short section which are never used in Mathlib at all.

---

- [ ] Question: What's the best thing to do here actually? Deleting them or putting them into a `Binary` namespace? If deleting, what should happen to the remaining 4 used ones?

This PR is also inspired by the following anomaly between `LeftInverse` and `RightInverse`:

```lean
import Mathlib.Init.Function
import Mathlib.Init.Logic -- contains `_root_.RightInverse`

open Function

variable (f g : Nat → Nat)

example : LeftInverse f g ∧ RightInverse f g := by
  /- with `Mathlib.Init.Logic`:
  f g : Nat → Nat
  ⊢ LeftInverse f g ∧ Function.RightInverse f g
  -/

  /- without `Mathlib.Init.Logic`:
  f g : Nat → Nat
  ⊢ LeftInverse f g ∧ RightInverse f g
  -/
  sorry
```
[webeditor](https://lean.math.hhu.de/#code=import%20Mathlib.Init.Function%0Aimport%20Mathlib.Init.Logic%20--%20contains%20%60_root_.RightInverse%60%0A%0Aopen%20Function%0A%0Avariable%20(f%20g%20%3A%20Nat%20%E2%86%92%20Nat)%0A%0Aexample%20%3A%20LeftInverse%20f%20g%20%E2%88%A7%20RightInverse%20f%20g%20%3A%3D%20by%0A%20%20%2F-%20with%20%60Mathlib.Init.Logic%60%3A%0A%20%20f%20g%20%3A%20Nat%20%E2%86%92%20Nat%0A%20%20%E2%8A%A2%20LeftInverse%20f%20g%20%E2%88%A7%20Function.RightInverse%20f%20g%0A%20%20-%2F%0A%0A%20%20%2F-%20without%20%60Mathlib.Init.Logic%60%3A%0A%20%20f%20g%20%3A%20Nat%20%E2%86%92%20Nat%0A%20%20%E2%8A%A2%20LeftInverse%20f%20g%20%E2%88%A7%20RightInverse%20f%20g%0A%20%20-%2F%0A%20%20sorry%0A)

Which is slightly confusing. Turns out `_root_.RightInverse` is not used at all in the entire Mathlib.

nodes.body: This file contains the essential change. Everything else are just fixes.

pullRequest.title: chore(Init/Logic): remove `Commutative` and `Associative` in favour of core declarations `Std.Commutative` and `Std.Associative`
